title: Ring of teleport control
data:
**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Ring_of_teleport_control/ko "Ring of teleport control/ko")

| =          |                                                               |   |   |
| ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- | - | - |
| Name       | teleport control                                              |   |   |
| Appearance | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |   |   |
| Base price | 300 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |   |   |
| Weight     | 3                                                             |   |   |

A **ring of teleport control** is a type of [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 Identification](#Identification)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 NetHack Fourk](#NetHack_Fourk)
  - [6.2 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [6.3 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [6.4 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

## Generation

In addition to random generation, the ring of teleport control can be sold in general [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and jewelers' shops.

## Description

While worn, the ring of teleport control conveys the [teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control") [extrinsic](/wiki/Extrinsic "Extrinsic").

[Eating](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry") a ring of teleport control has a 1⁄3 chance of granting [intrinsic](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic") teleport control.

## Strategy

The ring of teleport control is an incredibly useful source of the property, especially when combined with [teleportitis](/wiki/Teleportitis "Teleportitis") or a means of [level teleportation](/wiki/Level_teleportation "Level teleportation"). Compared to the teleport control intrinsic (e.g. from [tengu](/wiki/Tengu "Tengu")), the ring may be preferable for some characters up to and throughout the mid-game since it can be removed at will to make use of [vault](/wiki/Vault "Vault") [teleport traps](/wiki/Teleport_trap "Teleport trap").

When combined with [Gehennom mapping](/wiki/Gehennom_mapping "Gehennom mapping") methods in the late game, the ring can speed up navigation through [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") during the search for the [invocation items](/wiki/Invocation_items "Invocation items") and the [vibrating square](/wiki/Vibrating_square "Vibrating square"), as well as heading back up through the branch on the [ascension run](/wiki/Ascension_run "Ascension run") - as a result, it is not out place to see characters [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") up a ring of teleport control for their [ascension kit](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit").

### Identification

A ring of teleport control can be tricky to identify by wear-testing after [price identification](/wiki/Price_identification "Price identification"), due to the possibility of a 300zm ring non-cursed [ring of polymorph](/wiki/Ring_of_polymorph "Ring of polymorph") - careful testing for a [ring of conflict](/wiki/Ring_of_conflict "Ring of conflict") can help narrow down candidates.

One method of identifying a ring of teleport control is to wear the suspected (and ideally noncursed) ring and then attempting [teleportation](/wiki/Teleportation "Teleportation"), usually with a [teleport trap](/wiki/Teleport_trap "Teleport trap"), [scroll](/wiki/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation") or [wand](/wiki/Wand_of_teleportation "Wand of teleportation") - if you are wearing teleport control, you will be able to choose a destination square. A [sink](/wiki/Sink "Sink") can also be used to identify a ring of teleport control by dropping the suspected ring down it, which will produce a unique message.

## History

The ring of teleport control first appears in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

## Messages

- The sink looks like it is being beamed aboard somewhere.

  You dropped a ring of teleport control down a sink; this will prompt you to type-name the ring.

## Variants

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), two of the new final level maps for [the Fourk version of](/wiki/Sokoban_\(NetHack_Fourk\) "Sokoban (NetHack Fourk)") [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") have a sack which contains a ring of teleport control alongside a [ring of polymorph control](/wiki/Ring_of_polymorph_control "Ring of polymorph control") and a third random ring - if you already have either of the the first two rings, other jewellery may appear.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), a ring of teleport control can be created at a [furnace](/wiki/Furnace "Furnace") by combining a [ring of teleportation](/wiki/Ring_of_teleportation "Ring of teleportation") and a [ring of polymorph control](/wiki/Ring_of_polymorph_control "Ring of polymorph control"). A [ring of polymorph](/wiki/Ring_of_polymorph "Ring of polymorph") and a ring of teleport control can be combined to create a [ring of polymorph control](/wiki/Ring_of_polymorph_control "Ring of polymorph control").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), [the Rat King](/wiki/Rat_King_\(EvilHack\) "Rat King (EvilHack)") has a 2⁄3 chance of generating with a ring of teleport control. This is to make navigating his lair in the Sewers of Waterdeep variant of [Mines' End](/wiki/Mines%27_End "Mines' End") much less difficult, as it has various sections that can only be reached by teleporting.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), the Rat King is relocated to the lair of [his counterpart](/wiki/The_Rat_King_\(SLASH%27EM\) "The Rat King (SLASH'EM)") from [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), which is in the main branch of the dungeon, but retains the 2⁄3 chance of generating with a ring of teleport control as in EvilHack.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Ring of teleport control

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 한국어

=
Name teleport control
Appearance random
Base price 300 zm
Weight 3

A ring of teleport control is a type of ring that appears in NetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
    • 3.1 Identification
  • 4 History
  • 5 Messages
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 NetHack Fourk
    • 6.2 SpliceHack
    • 6.3 EvilHack
    • 6.4 Hack'EM

Generation

In addition to random generation, the ring of teleport control can be sold in general shops and jewelers' shops.

Description

While worn, the ring of teleport control conveys the teleport control extrinsic.

Eating a ring of teleport control has a 1⁄3 chance of granting intrinsic teleport control.

Strategy

The ring of teleport control is an incredibly useful source of the property, especially when combined with teleportitis or a means of level teleportation. Compared to the teleport control intrinsic (e.g. from tengu), the ring may be preferable for some characters up to and throughout the mid-game since it can be removed at will to make use of vault teleport traps.

When combined with Gehennom mapping methods in the late game, the ring can speed up navigation through Gehennom during the search for the invocation items and the vibrating square, as well as heading back up through the branch on the ascension run - as a result, it is not out place to see characters wish up a ring of teleport control for their ascension kit.

Identification

A ring of teleport control can be tricky to identify by wear-testing after price identification, due to the possibility of a 300zm ring non-cursed ring of polymorph - careful testing for a ring of conflict can help narrow down candidates.

One method of identifying a ring of teleport control is to wear the suspected (and ideally noncursed) ring and then attempting teleportation, usually with a teleport trap, scroll or wand - if you are wearing teleport control, you will be able to choose a destination square. A sink can also be used to identify a ring of teleport control by dropping the suspected ring down it, which will produce a unique message.

History

The ring of teleport control first appears in Hack 1.0.

Messages

The sink looks like it is being beamed aboard somewhere.
You dropped a ring of teleport control down a sink; this will prompt you to type-name the ring.

Variants

NetHack Fourk

In NetHack Fourk, two of the new final level maps for the Fourk version of Sokoban have a sack which contains a ring of teleport control alongside a ring of polymorph control and a third random ring - if you already have either of the the first two rings, other jewellery may appear.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, a ring of teleport control can be created at a furnace by combining a ring of teleportation and a ring of polymorph control. A ring of polymorph and a ring of teleport control can be combined to create a ring of polymorph control.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, the Rat King has a 2⁄3 chance of generating with a ring of teleport control. This is to make navigating his lair in the Sewers of Waterdeep variant of Mines' End much less difficult, as it has various sections that can only be reached by teleporting.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, the Rat King is relocated to the lair of his counterpart from SLASH'EM, which is in the main branch of the dungeon, but retains the 2⁄3 chance of generating with a ring of teleport control as in EvilHack.

Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Ring_of_teleport_control&oldid=162710"

{{ring
 |name=teleport control

}}

A '''ring of teleport control''' is a type of [[ring]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''.

==Generation==
In addition to random generation, the ring of teleport control can be sold in general [[shop]]s and jewelers' shops.

==Description==
While worn, the ring of teleport control conveys the [[teleport control]] [[extrinsic]].

[[Eating jewelry|Eating]] a ring of teleport control has a {{frac|3}} chance of granting [[intrinsic]] teleport control.

==Strategy==
The ring of teleport control is an incredibly useful source of the property, especially when combined with [[teleportitis]] or a means of [[level teleportation]]. Compared to the teleport control intrinsic (e.g. from [[tengu]]), the ring may be preferable for some characters up to and throughout the mid-game since it can be removed at will to make use of [[vault]] [[teleport trap]]s.

When combined with [[Gehennom mapping]] methods in the late game, the ring can speed up navigation through [[Gehennom]] during the search for the [[invocation items]] and the [[vibrating square]], as well as heading back up through the branch on the [[ascension run]] - as a result, it is not out place to see characters [[wish]] up a ring of teleport control for their [[ascension kit]].

===Identification===
A ring of teleport control can be tricky to identify by wear-testing after [[price identification]], due to the possibility of a 300zm ring non-cursed [[ring of polymorph]] - careful testing for a [[ring of conflict]] can help narrow down candidates.

One method of identifying a ring of teleport control is to wear the suspected (and ideally noncursed) ring and then attempting [[teleportation]], usually with a [[teleport trap]], [[scroll of teleportation|scroll]] or [[wand of teleportation|wand]] - if you are wearing teleport control, you will be able to choose a destination square. A [[sink]] can also be used to identify a ring of teleport control by dropping the suspected ring down it, which will produce a unique message.

==History==
The ring of teleport control first appears in [[Hack 1.0]].

==Messages==
{{message|The sink looks like it is being beamed aboard somewhere.|You dropped a ring of teleport control down a sink; this will prompt you to type-name the ring.}}

==Variants==
===NetHack Fourk===
In [[NetHack Fourk]], two of the new final level maps for [[Sokoban (NetHack Fourk)|the Fourk version of]] [[Sokoban]] have a sack which contains a ring of teleport control alongside a [[ring of polymorph control]] and a third random ring - if you already have either of the the first two rings, other jewellery may appear.

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], a ring of teleport control can be created at a [[furnace]] by combining a [[ring of teleportation]] and a [[ring of polymorph control]]. A [[ring of polymorph]] and a ring of teleport control can be combined to create a [[ring of polymorph control]].

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], [[Rat King (EvilHack)|the Rat King]] has a {{frac|2|3}} chance of generating with a ring of teleport control. This is to make navigating his lair in the Sewers of Waterdeep variant of [[Mines' End]] much less difficult, as it has various sections that can only be reached by teleporting.

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], the Rat King is relocated to the lair of [[The Rat King (SLASH'EM)|his counterpart]] from [[SLASH'EM]], which is in the main branch of the dungeon, but retains the {{frac|2|3}} chance of generating with a ring of teleport control as in EvilHack.
